contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Radio station | name = XHAGC | image = <!-- Commented out because image was deleted: [[Image:XHAGC-FM.JPG]] --> | city = [[Aguascalientes, Aguascalientes]], [[Mexico]] | area = [[Aguascalientes]] | branding = Exa FM | slogan = Exa FM es la Neta | airdate = October 1, 2001 | frequency = 97.3 ([[Megahertz|MHz]]) | format = [[Contemporary hit radio|Spanish & English Top 40 (CHR)]] | power = 56,700 [[watt]]s | erp = | class = | callsign_meaning = | former_callsigns = | owner = [http://www.radiouniversal.com.mx/ Radio Universal] | webcast = | website = [http://www.exafm.com/aguascalientes www.exafm.com/aguascalientes] | affiliations = [[MVS Radio]] }} '''XHAGC''' is a [[Contemporary hit radio|Spanish & English Top 40 (CHR)]] music radio radio station that serves the state of [[Aguascalientes]]. The station began during the 70's as an adult contemporary Spanish station under the name of '''''Sono Imagen''''', a name that lasted for two decades. In 1996 the station was named '''''FM Globo''''' and became part of the FM Globo network as a result of a partnership between Radio Universal and MVS Radio. On October 1, 2001 the station changed its format to a Top 40 station and became '''''Exa FM'''''. ==External links== * [http://www.exafm.com Official website] * [http://www.radiouniversal.com.mx/exa.php Exa FM 97.3] <br clear=all> {{Aguascalientes Radio}} {{coord missing|Mexico}} [[Category:Regional Mexican radio stations]] [[Category:Spanish-language radio stations]] [[Category:Radio stations in Aguascalientes]] [[Category:Media in Aguascalientes, Aguascalientes]] {{Mexico-radio-station-stub}}
